articles.description: Like the coronavirus, the 1918 flu pandemic led to a rise in xenophobia and budget cuts. Then it helped usher in Nazi rule, according to new research
articles.content: A new study by an economist at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York linked the 1918 flu pandemic to the rise in Nazi support in Germany, a finding that could have significant relevance as the United States and the world grapples with the health and economic d… [+7504 chars]

articles.title: 'Repurposed' drugs showing promise as COVID-19 treatments: Chief Scientist - ABC News
articles.description: Australia's Chief Scientist Dr Alan Finkel has been been chairing the 'Rapid Response Information Forum', set up to support the Government with information during the Covid-19 crisis.
articles.content:
Australia's Chief Scientist Dr Alan Finkel has been playing an important role during the COVID-19 crisis, he's been chairing the 'Rapid Response Information Forum'.
It's a strike-force made up of experts from 35 leading science and research organisations, wh… [+219 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus plan for Victoria includes new testing blitz and $20m rapid response 'outbreak unit' - msnNOW
articles.description: A new rapid response coronavirus "outbreak unit" is being set up in the Victorian Health Department as the Government announces a new testing blitz aiming to swab 150,000 people for COVID-19 by the end of May.
articles.content:
Another 150,000 Victorians, enough people to fill the MCG one-and-a-half times, will be tested for coronavirus by the end of the month under a State Government plan to help decide which restrictions can be lifted.
